page.title: 09Hartfield School
page.content: The school was built in 1842 but an older wooden building was there before this.A hall and two classes were added in the 1960's.There are 4 classes and 5 teachers plus part time help for French.We also have 3 helpers and 3 cooks. There are around 100 children. We play football playtimes and after dinner.A typical dinner:pork & potato casserole,rice,peas & sweetcorn, doughnuts and jam sauce.We have 5 or 6 lessons a day. Maths.,English,French, sport,general studies etc. We have 2 computers with disc drives,a video recorder and lots more. There are two playgrounds, one for the infants and the other for the juniors.There is a house attatched for the head teacher.The school is surrounded by the church yard and fields.As the schoolm is getting bigger we are to have another class.
